node.title: Efat couldn't say goodbye to her family when she fled Kabul. Now she doesn't know if she'll see them again
node.alt: A woman in a yellow dress smiles and sits on a plane
node.description: Recently evacuated Afghans are pleading withÂ the federal government to prioritise their families' visa applications because of their connections to Australia, amid concerns they could be targeted by the Taliban.
node.content:
["Efat left Kabul in such a hurry she didn't get a chance to say\u00a0goodbye to her parents and siblings.", "The Hazara woman, who worked as an interpreter for Australian and US troops,\u00a0knew a future in Taliban-controlled Afghanistan was not an option for her.", "The 28-year-old\u00a0spent two weeks\u00a0in the heat, staking out the crowded gates of Kabul International Airport for an\u00a0opportunity to flee Afghanistan,\u00a0after\u00a0Taliban insurgents captured the country.", "Once she saw a chance to leave, she had to seize the opportunity and didn't have time to go back and farewell her family.", "Now living\u00a0in Adelaide, Efat, who\u00a0is not using\u00a0her real name because of\u00a0concerns for her family's safety,\u00a0wants to urgently\u00a0bring\u00a0her family to Australia.", "She fears they could become\u00a0targets because of their Hazara\u00a0ethnicity and her work with coalition forces.", "\"Every day\u00a0and every moment I'm thinking \u00a0\u2026\u00a0'how should I get them out of that country?'\u00a0because there is no life for\u00a0\u2026\u00a0them [there],\" she told the ABC.", "\"I am all by myself and I have not a single person of my family with me \u2026 the problem is that I have in my mind that they're in a place that is not safe for them.\"", "In the wake of the US withdrawal in August, Afghans who worked with the coalition forces have been killed.\u00a0", "The Taliban\u00a0have also been\u00a0evicting Hazara, who are Shia Muslims,\u00a0from their homes and land\u00a0while Islamic State have begun launching deadly suicide bombings on areas where they live.\u00a0", "", "
Efat says the Australian government needs to help those like her family still in Afghanistan.
", "Efat said she had\u00a0held off submitting a visa application for her family because she didn't know how many family members she could bring to Australia.", "But in response to questions by the ABC, the Department of Home Affairs said there was no limit on the number of close family members a humanitarian visa holder could propose.", "Efat said while she was grateful\u00a0the Australian government had helped people like herself evacuate, the\u00a0government should make\u00a0the guidelines around applying for visas for family in Afghanistan clearer.\u00a0", "\"Please bring our families to us, please make us feel like we're going to\u00a0see our family members again,\" she said, holding back tears.", "
'Pretty disastrous' visa process
", "While some\u00a0former interpreters for Australian forces\u00a0have made it to Australia, others in Afghanistan are still waiting for visas.\u00a0", "The Australian\u00a0government has opened 3,000 humanitarian visas for Afghans wanting to flee, but\u00a0a Senate inquiry last week heard none of those humanitarian visas had been issued\u00a0despite the government receiving more than 20,000 applications.", "", "
Glenn Kolomeitz says the federal government should prioritise visas for Afghans with connections to Australia.(Four Corners)
", "Veteran and lawyer\u00a0Glenn Kolomeitz\u00a0said Australia's humanitarian visa process for Afghans had\u00a0been \"pretty disastrous\".", "\"To date, none of those have been given permanent visas. Many have been given very short-term, temporary safe haven visas.\"", "Mr\u00a0Kolomeitz made a submission to a Defence and Foreign Affairs Senate inquiry\u00a0probing\u00a0the federal\u00a0government's two-stage\u00a0visa application process for former Afghan employees of Australian government\u00a0agencies.", "In his submission, he said some former Afghan interpreters for Australia could not complete the second part of their application because Australia had already closed its embassy in Kabul.", "The Department of Foreign Affairs did not respond to the ABC's request for comment.\u00a0", "Mr\u00a0Kolomeitz told the ABC\u00a0the families of former locally engaged interpreters also\u00a0faced a heightened risk of persecution in Taliban-controlled Afghanistan and should be prioritised.\u00a0", "\"All of our clients who are here in Australia\u00a0\u2026 have family in Afghanistan, that gives them a very strong link to Australia\u00a0\u2026 but these people are still not being prioritised,\" he said.", "\"What we're seeing is they're simply joining the\u00a0pile of other applications from every other Afghan who was applying\u00a0to come to Australia on humanitarian grounds.\"", "
Fears the Taliban will target interpreters' families\u00a0
", "Ahmad,\u00a0who worked with ADF soldiers in Afghanistan, also has\u00a0family in the country and fears the Taliban will target them.", "The ABC is not using Ahmad's real name to protect his family's identity.", "", "
Ahmad says he is worried his family in Afghanistan will not be approved for a visa.(AP:\u00a0Wali Sabawoon)
", "He said he had\u00a0contacted migration lawyers and prepared\u00a0visa application forms\u00a0to try and get his family an Australian visa.", "But\u00a0with thousands of other Afghans applying for just a few thousand\u00a0visas, he is\u00a0worried his family will not make the cut.", "\"I know their families, they want to get their members, their loved ones over here but the amount of risk to the Afghan interpreters' families from [the] Taliban in Afghanistan is\u00a0more than any other thing you can think [of],\" Ahmad said.", "\"I've heard rumours and there has been some activities\u00a0by the Taliban, that they are looking for the families of the Afghan interpreters.\"", "He has\u00a0joined calls to\u00a0prioritise the families of Afghan interpreters for humanitarian visas.\u00a0", "\"I[t]\u00a0will be very good, if they can prioritise the visa for the Afghan interpreters' families\u00a0first, especially their parents, because \u2026\u00a0most of these interpreters were living with their parents\u00a0in one house,\" he said.", "\"If they cannot get out on time, sooner or later the Taliban will come and come after them.\"", "
Hanging onto hope
", "", "
Some families have still managed to flee Afghanistan.(AP:\u00a0Khwaja Tawfiq Sediqi)
", "Mr\u00a0Kolomeitz said there was still hope for recently evacuated Afghans in Australia wanting to reunite with their families.", "\"We got a family out in the last week, whose interpreter family live here in Australia [and] are permanent residents,\" he said.", "\"But there are still many family members stuck in Afghanistan who\u00a0we and others are working on getting visas for and evacuating.\"", "In\u00a0response to questions from the ABC, the Department of Home Affairs said priority would be given to persecuted minorities, women and children and those who have links to Australia.", "For Efat, she just wants to see her parents and siblings again, out of harm's way.", "\"I have my brothers younger than me and \u2026\u00a0they have not even started their life yet and they're struggling,\" she said."]
